name: Terrifying Bounty Hunter: Rogue(11), Ranger(9), Barbarian(20)
author: eltalstro

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
Class Race           Rogue(11), Ranger(9), Barbarian(20), Half-Orc
PVM (Made this up for Swordflight)

This is the first time I've ever done a build incorporating dev crit and terrifying rage so any suggestions will be appreciated. I started out with an 18 strength half-orc but am going to start over with 19 strength so I can take dev crit at level 24. I also had Wisdom at 12 but the Ranger spells really aren't worth the extra points into wis and I added epic will to make up for the will save problem (not that it makes the will save particularly impressive). One of the main conundrums I have had is whether to go Ranger for the free two weapon feats or to take fighter and get the associated extra feats but then I would have had to take a point away from wisdom (no worries) and another point from somewhere else (more of a worry) in order to get ambidexterity (15 dex required). And then, with no ranger levels, he'd be more of a terrifying something other than a bounty hunter. Also, the skill points are a bit of a mess and spread a bit thin (especially between spot and search).

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Not the biggest expert on the classes listed or the module. Just going to comment on obvious things I can see that might help.

Skill points seem tough as a Half Orc with Int 10. You could take rogue at level 1 for an extra 16 skill points and delay the tumble dump to level 7. UMD 33 (modified) would allow you to cast level 9 spells from scrolls without chance of failure. As a strength build, you probably will want to max discipline, unless you plan on using knockdown immune items, then spend your points elsewhere :) Not sure if they use disarm in sword flight (which would be the other reason to skill up discipline).

You take 8 levels of rogue pre-epic. Is it possible to cut it back to 4 levels of rogue pre-epic for +1 AB and take the further rogue levels in your epic levels. The exp multi class penalty could be managed by going preepic Barb 12 Ranger 4 Rogue 4? Rogue Skill dumps could be at 1, 7, 12 and 17. I don't think this would compromise playability.

RE Ranger 9 vs Fighter level equivalent (or even CoT) for access to ITWF, its a good question. My preference is to choose fighter unless you plan on totally dumping your Dex statistic. Your Dex is 14 so getting an extra point when you level up is not too bad, you are right in that it might delay Dev Crit. You can get ITWF with 6 levels of fighter purely from bonus feats, and not be restricted RE armor and have access to Weapon Specialisation / Epic Weapon Specialisation. Further bonus fighter bonus feats in epic levels are nice ie epic prowess, armor skin, epic weapon focus, overwhelming and devastating critical as well.

Anyway hope that helps

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content: All good points, Orion. I took Barbarian at level 1 because I was really struggling to make any headway at all in Swordflight as a level 1 rogue (like getting killed over and over and over during the first encounter). What I may do is start from level 2 which would be much better overall for the build. Disarm is definitely used in Swordflight and yes, a higher discipline score would be preferable. I think, but I can't confirm this, that UMD doesn't cover scrolls in Swordflight. Having gone through to an adjusted UMD score of 10 I still couldn't use low-level scrolls. I'm going to have a tinker with this after reading through your comments and I'll post an update.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
a) Try ending on an even-strength score.
b) Modify your class-split to rogue-13-barbarian-17-ranger 10, it is much better.
c) I am not aware if you know this, but terrifying rage isn't at all "terrifying" in the vanilla game. It's only on WoG & some other select few PWs that has been modified as such.

Good for first try eltalstro, we'll help you making it better.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
eltalstro wrote: Having gone through to an adjusted UMD score of 10 I still couldn't use low-level scrolls. I'm going to have a tinker with this after reading through your comments and I'll post an update.
Could be module related. If it isn't, could it be a low UMD score?

The Use Magical Device DC check for scrolls is as follows: 
You must make a DC check of 25 + the level of the spell to cast a spell from a scroll if the difficulty mode of the game is set to Hardcore or higher.
To cast a level 1 scroll you would need to pass a DC check of 26. With modified UMD 10, you would need to roll a 16 or higher, so a level 1 scroll would only work 25% of the time...

Anyway I'll leave that thought with you :) hope it helps

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
How high UMD one needs to cast successfully from scrolls depends on the difficulty setting you choose for your game. If you play on Hardcore DnD, that is recommended for this series, the DC is 25 + spell level.
For some reason Bard is an exception and only needs high enough UMD to use the scroll, based on the gold value of the scroll and will always succeed at casting.

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content: There's always something that ruins the party when you try branching out in NWN. I figured that Swordflight would be more interesting with a strong intimidate score with all of the conversation options that come up. Then I thought that this would tie in nicely with terrifying rage. I'm just going to play around with it in my testing module. As always thanks for the tips.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Well, you'll want to max your Intimidate anyway for the Terrifying Rage DC (not much point in having the feat if even paranoid snails just go "meh" when you roar at them).

But you definitely want to max Discipline as well. Heal is not particularly useful in skill terms - as long as you can use kits you don't need any more invested. Search might also be a bit high (again, not much point in finding traps if you can't do anything about them - I suppose getting bits of you blown off won't come as quite the same surprise, looking on the sunny side of things).

And I'm definitely with Valerfor on the class split and starting stats. And do go for Rogue at level 1 - you need the skills. I do understand what you say about the start of the module (though I've only played the first 2 parts) - it's the second time I've been KBR (killed by rats), which is highly embarrassing, even when solo.

Are you thinking of Dual-Wielding scimitars? I know they've got better crit range than most, but you'll be hitting yourself with -2 AB in each hand, and having a melee build with less than 40 AB is dodgy at best - and you can't kill 'em if you can't hit 'em. And I do worry a bit about your AC.

Hope this doesn't come across too negatively - it's not meant to. Here to help, and all that!

Anyway, discussion progresses...

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
(Edit: I got sick of writing and revising this on my phone)

No worries at all Stag. Historically, I've never used rogue as a class and never made a dual wield build. I decided to start at lvl two Ro/F rather than try for hours to get the rolls right to kill all the rats. I've always managed to smash through modules pretty easily even on very difficult so it's kind of depressing realising how much I don't know about something that I've spent what can only be described as an unhealthy amount of time doing. I realise kukri would be a better choice for a power build but for RP and aesthetics I'm going scimitar and can always switch over to using a shield when the going gets really rough. The build could definitely use more AC. The issue I have (as is always the case) is opportunity cost. Lower Int, lose skills. Lower Con, lose rage duration/HP/Fort and so on. I did a revised build using fighter instead of ranger and tested it out against all of the best opposition I could muster and just minced mobs of Balor Lords, ancient dragons "ultimate Rakshasa" and so on. I maxed intimidate and the terrifying rage worked pretty well (well enough to incapacitate then hit an enemy once and watch them explode into a mess of blood and bones).The only major difficulty was in coming up against "impossible"  "ultra iron golems" which are obviously immune to crits and sneak attack and hit very hard. The AC was found lacking. In all honesty, you guys must get bored doing modules because I find them pretty easy most of the time. My toons rarely get killed. I've done quite a lot of things to a reasonably high level including sports and music. This reminds me of when I was playing guitar pretty well after years of practice and then stepping in with pro players and just wanting to throw the guitar through a window. The "e" in ecb it seems, is pretty accurate. I think it was Mick who said it best "building is hard" (was that you Mick?). It's soooooooo hard. The depth of knowledge required for just one type of build is immense. While I'm sure they would spurn power gaming, I wonder if Gary Gygax and Dave Arneson fully understood the depth of complexity that would develop in character building and how it would become a science all of its own.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Dual scimitar or even dual longsword is definitely cool looking, even if you have a slightly lower AB for not wielding a light weapon in the offhand... or a slightly lower AB for dual wielding instead of sword and shield...


Source: community NWN portrait packs

Mick Dagger wrote: How high UMD one needs to cast successfully from scrolls depends on the difficulty setting you choose for your game. If you play on Hardcore DnD, that is recommended for this series, the DC is 25 + spell level. 
For some reason Bard is an exception and only needs high enough UMD to use the scroll, based on the gold value of the scroll and will always succeed at casting.
I learnt something about Bards and UMD, thanks Mick! :) Honestly I have learnt so much from you guys over such a short space of time

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
Whilst on the subject of the kukri (traditional weapon of the Gurkha) I thought I'd affirm that they are no joke even in reality and fully deserve the crit range that they are allocated. I remembered reading about them years ago on Wikipedia: 

"The kukri is effective as a chopping weapon, due to its weight, and slashing weapon, because the curved shape creates a "wedge" effect which causes the blade to cut effectively and deeper. Because the blade bends towards the opponent, the user need not angle the wrist while executing a chopping motion. Unlike a straight-edged sword, the centre of mass combined with the angle of the blade allow the kukri to slice as it chops.The edge slides across the target's surface while the centre of mass maintains momentum as the blade moves through the target's cross-section. This gives the kukri a penetrative force disproportional to its length. The design enables the user to inflict deep wounds and to penetrate bone." It's also one of the weapons used to kill Dracula in the original tale.

DAMMIT, Stag! Now you've got me thinking about Kukri! See this is the problem I have with getting involved here (with the greatest possible respect and admiration). I stayed away for quite a while for the fact that it is a neverending rabbit hole of opportunity cost and second-guessing to the point that I end up constantly going back to the drawing board and only partially completing playthroughs before realising what "could be" and then rebuilding. It is good to find out that what I thought was a reasonable build is actually relatively terrible but this is actually driving me a bit crazy.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
At the risk of helping not at all with your dilemma, you'd need to take Exotic Weapon Proficiency in order to go with kukris. and you've got precisely 0 feats spare. I suppose there's Blind Fight, but I'd be very cautious about dropping that one. Which brings us back to considering Fighter instead of Ranger, 10 levels of which would bring 6 bonus feats. That means you could take the 3 dual-wield feats, Weapon Specialization and its Epic brother, and Exotic Weapon Proficiency. And, of course, enables Heavy Armour.

Just saying...

I know just what you mean about that rabbit hole. It's dark and scary down there, but fear not, intrepid adventurer - we're always here to point and laugh help if we can 😉! I know I still need it. For me, though, I love the journey - "Ooh, let's go this way! Dead end. What about this way? Too narrow. How about over here..." (repeat ad infinitum). It's one of the things that makes NwN so addictive. And it's one of the reasons replaying modules is rewarding - it's a very different experience playing a CON-heavy DwD from a DEX-based dodging wee shadow of a thing, and so on. Endless Tales indeed...

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content: Yeah, I'm playing around with a fighter based variant of the same concept incorporating some of the advice above with kukris at the moment. Either way (scimitar or kukri), it struggles against damage reduction and I had to get a spare two-hander to deal with constructs and undead with damage reduction. I quite like search because, besides traps, you get to find things that you otherwise would not find. The jack of all trades master of none issue is real but I also like to have some ability to spot enemies before wandering into an ambush while soloing. In a PW you fare much better with a low spread of skills because the individuals bring many skills to the table in a synergistic manner. The rogue scouts, the tank tanks, the wizard casts and the bard plays a little ditty and the ranger talks to animals while everyone else wonders what they are saying.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Since we're talking about Kukri fighting, I'll just leave this here.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I know this one's outside what you're looking for here, but it's one I've played - and it's frightening what those twin tiny blades can do...

Kukri Saint

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Eltalstro, you've mentioned that you actually play this build on Swordflight. At which point you are at? How far have you progressed with the build?

Maybe we can tweak the build that you play for better results.

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:Good for first try eltalstro, we'll help you making it better.
This is my favourite quote in this thread 😆

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Daggers and shortswords have not quite the critical threat range of kukris, but they do not require the Exotic Weapons feat.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Good point Empyre & usually there always are, good short-swords on any module, while kama/ kukri might be restricted to some.

For the build, Just by changing the spread around to Barb 17/ Rogue 13/ Ranger 10 & by changing "terrifying rage" to another "great strength" instead, it gets bumped up by two points already.

(One for higher strength & one from taking epic prowess from Ranger 10, in epic.)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote: Good point Empyre & usually there always are, good short-swords on any module, while kama/ kukri might be restricted to some.

For the build, Just by changing the spread around to Barb 17/ Rogue 13/ Ranger 10 & by changing "terrifying rage" to another "great strength" instead, it gets bumped up by two points already.

(One for higher strength & one from taking epic prowess from Ranger 10, in epic.)
Er, I know we play fast and loose with lots of things here (and I'm aware I'm probably more guilty of that than most if not all of us), but wasn't the main point of the build Dev Crit and Terrifying Rage? Yes, both AS and EP take a dive currently, but we're still going, yes? And if eltalstro decides to stick with Ranger, maybe hatchets would be good (less crit range, but x3 damage)?

Still a fan of the Barb 17/ Rogue 13/ either Ranger or Fighter 10, btw.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
It was indeed, then maybe a good suggestion would be to exchange a great strength for esf: intimidate, to ensure he will be really, err, terrifying!

His AB/ Dmg will stay the same since he will end on an even score.

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote: Eltalstro, you've mentioned that you actually play this build on Swordflight. At which point you are at? How far have you progressed with the build?

Maybe we can tweak the build that you play for better results.
Thanks, Valefor and everyone for taking an interest. I started a reply to this last night and it occurred to me that I should explain my rationale. 
  • I needed to get as many R levels in as early as possible to get ITWF at level nine which meant at least eight Ro levels pre-epic. 
  • I'm interested in making the build as strong as possible with a few purposeful flaws like dual wielding scimitars (I'm seriously thinking about ditching this now).
  • I went for heal because healing in combat doesn't provoke AoO and UD allows you to retain dex to AC and there is a lot of serious poisoning and disease going down early in the game. However, dex is a not prominent feature of this build so I'm throwing out heal in favour of potions and scrolls which are eye wateringly more expensive early but have a negligible cost as you get cashed up.
  • The odd number of Str? I always figured Str modifier is dependent entirely on what items you find and it would be a toss-up as to whether you end up on an odd or even number after adding gear but I'm sure you all know better than me.
  • Search I want to keep (should I invest less?). There are a lot of secret doors and hidden items in Swordflight. I am unaware of whether you can find them without search but if you can that's pretty lame. What's the point of having "secret" doors if anyone can find them. And if I'm going to trigger a trap I want it to be on my terms. Stepping on traps really annoys me.
  • Terrifying rage? I decided to invest in a conversation skill to fit the module and intimidate fit the bill. Also, I've never used TR before and it sounds cool. I believe you, Valerfor but sometimes I just have to do things for myself and be disappointed with the results. It seems to work ok in my testing mod.
  • Two-weapon fighting? I've never made a decent dual wield character before. I figured that the more attacks you get, the more chance you have of landing a dev crit. 
  • Dual-wield? I realise this somewhat contradicts the previous bullet point but they just look cool in the hands of a half-orc and it's Calimshan and there are good scimitars available in the first two chapters. "Dagger and short sword for sissies!" (sorry Empyre 😀). I do kinda like the hatchet idea though Stag, but I'm thinking about dropping dual wield altogether and going with sword and board. I think I've mentioned it before and it probably sounds weird but I start with a concept, find a portrait that captures my imagination and then try to make the build fit that concept, down to trying to make the toon look as much like the portrait as possible.
Overall I was trying to fit ITWF, Dev crit, and terrifying rage all in by level 24 with tumble and UMD in a half-orc and it just wasn't going to happen. Perhaps if I went human, Ro, Bb, CoT it might be doable? But that would be a totally different PC. I'm ditching R in favour of F.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
What you said intrigued me enough so that I try it myself, didn't succeed but in the end, I think I came close enough.
Didn't try for an uber power-build here (I know you like to prove yourself worthy), aimed more for a roleplay build that feels strong all-around.
I hope that you will like it eltalstro & inspire you to make an even better one yourself.

ELTALSTRO'S FURIOUS DECIMATOR

BARBARIAN 24/ ROGUE 6/ CHAMPION OF TORM 10

“Overall I was trying to fit ITWF, Dev crit, and terrifying rage all in by level 24 with tumble and UMD in a half-orc and it just wasn't going to happen. “
"Well, it didn't...At least, at level 24 that is..."

Race: Half-Orc
Alignment: True Neutral
Playable: PvM 1-40 level

STR:  18 (30)
DEX:  15
CON: 14
WIS:  08
INT:    12
CHA: 06

Hit Points: 504
DR: 5/ –

Skill Points: 219
Discipline: 43 (53)
Intimidate: 43 (51)
Tumble: 40 (42)
Search: 24 (25)
Listen: 34 (33)
Use Magic Device: 35 (33)

Saving Throws (Fort/Ref/Will): 29/ 29/ 20

AC (Naked/Armoured): 22/ 32 (Full Plate & Tower Shield)

BAB: 29 (Four Attacks/ Six Attacks w/Dual-Wielding)
AB: +43/ +38/ +33/ +28 (Handaxe) OR
AB: +41/ +41/ +36/ +36/ +31/ +26 (Dual Handaxes)
DMG: 1d6 +10/ 19-20 x3 & 1d6 +5/ 19-20 x3 (Dual Handaxes)

Devastating Critical DC: 40 (46)
Greater Terrifying Rage DC: 52-61 Will Save OR Paralyze for 1d3 Rounds

Special: Darkvision, Fast Movement, Evasion, Improved Uncanny Dodge, Sneak Attack +3d6

Leveling Guide:

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I like Valefor's build here. CoT is a nice solution to avoid the multiclass exp penalty and get some bonus feats to fit both ITWF / Dev crit / Blind fight and knockdown in the build

In terms of optimisation I think based on what you've written eltastro you aren't super keen on short swords so I think that's why Valefor has chosen handaxe, but the critical range is wider with short swords and this would produce nicer synergy with dev crit. Going through Aielund with Ronan Aethur in my party with his dual short swords, often glowing with elemental energy - lets just say I found he was not a weak character in terms of combat or style.

If we had Int 13 or 14 one could have access to improved knockdown but the points would have to come from cons dex or str (I'd favour cons 12 / int 14 but I don't know the module so well). would give 43 extra skill points which could be invested in other things, more roguish abilities or even cc spellcraft ... nothing is added into a build that comes for free

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content: I like it Valerfor... But I'm going evil 👿 I also like the "ROAR!" for terrifying rage. It will sound like this: "ME SMASH YOU UP!" I will definitely give that a try in the future. Another thing I have been putting more thought into is that Con is used to determine the duration of the rage; I like that for some reason. Orion, it's not that I have a particular axe to grind with small swords or daggers but Grurak, the future terrifying barbarian, thinks they are more suited to opening the summons letters he gets from the Calimport city watch or for playing stabberscotch (stab between the fingers game) at the tavern to try to impress disinterested women. He does like hand axes.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Alright, I wonder, then, whether this would work for you as evil, but using the essence of Valerfor's above build? It would entail losing Epic Skill Focus: Discipline and AN Other epic feat (probably Epic Prowess), but you'd gain Weapon Specialization and its epic brother (and you'd get Heavy Armour Proficiency for free). It's a Barb 26/ Rog 6/ Fghtr 8. With a split of Barb 11/ Rog 4/ Fghtr 5 pre-epic and Barb 15/ Rog 2/ Fghtr 3 in epic (taking both WS and EWS in epic) you also avoid the xp penalty. Obviously, if you're not bothered about WS/EWS, you get to keep the ESkF and EP. It will also have a negative impact on your saves, but that's inevitable if not taking CoT.

Just a thought for you to consider

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
As an incidental, once you'd reminded me about CON's impact, I started wondering about whether TR, Dev Crit, and EDR could successfully come together. And what do you know - they can! Here's a link to Max's HOOD (Half-Orc of Doom). It ain't exactly what you want here, but it's a really interesting build and well worth a look...

HOOD

posts.author: eltalstro
posts.content:
Stagmeister wrote: As an incidental, once you'd reminded me about CON's impact, I started wondering about whether TR, Dev Crit, and EDR could successfully come together. And what do you know - they can! Here's a link to Max's HOOD (Half-Orc of Doom). It ain't exactly what you want here, but it's a really interesting build and well worth a look...

HOOD
Once again it's RDD for the win! I was thinking about it in the back of my head the whole way through but ignoring it. It really is the obvious choice with the boosts to STR, CON and CHA. As much as I like to do things myself, I think I'll give it a go.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: I know, it's a bugger of a thing, ain't it? RDD seems a bit like a sugar-rush - it really makes you feel good, but also a bit dirty at the same time.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
BTW Valerfor has a nice Bard/RDD/PM build, AB 43 AC 107 buffed and equipped, crit immune sneak immune fire immune (+ more immunities) access to both Epic Mage Armor and Epic Warding and high levels of UMD tumble spellcraft etc. 

andariel-maiden-of-anguish-bard-5-rdd-1 ... 50062.html

Searched the forum for pale master builds when I came across it. 

By the way, in practice is there much difference between an AC of 70, 80, 90, 100 etc... I get the feeling above 80 it's gonna be a game of 20s just to be hit anyway, assuming a boss has an AB of 55-60

Another build on my list to try...

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
When you say you had to search the forum, was that using the Guild Filter? It works in much the same way as the Legacy Archives search function, but covers all the complete builds from this forum from 2011 - Jan 2017, and Andariel is definitely there.

ECB Guild Filter

The link in Hip's post takes you to the Vault, where the download is available. I know it specifies Excel, but it works with Open Office just as well ('cos that's what I use).

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hey Stag

Uh you caught me up on a very poorly worded sentence, the word 'had' was a redundancy and I will remove it, and it does evoke somewhat negative connotations which was not my intention. 

Basically I was looking up PM builds when I found it that powerful uber build and thought of eltalstro's comment on RDDs and decided to share.

The filter is good and I've got a copy of it. It is very user friendly and is similar to the search engine for the old forum. 

My other search tools I use are Tapatalk search and Google search. If its a really simple search then Tapatalk is easy. For something more complex I'm super familiar with google search so I tend to use that a lot. 

On this occasion I used the Tapatalk search function. It's not quite as user friendly as the spreadsheet and I haven't figured out how to use the 'OR' function or brackets (ie for synonyms, a build creator could use 'pm' or 'palemaster').


If I wanted to search google for pale master builds I would use the function 

site:https://www.tapatalk.com/groups/nwnecbguild/ "pale master" or "pale master" or "pm"




If I want RDD/PM builds I would use:

site:https://www.tapatalk.com/groups/nwnecbguild/ ("pale master" or "pale master" or "pm") AND ("red dragon disciple" or "RDD)




Anyway, these are the tools I use to search, happy to give away all my secrets

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: That's what I'm using when searching in massive sites like RPG.Net, Giant in the Playground, Dragonsfoot & Enworld, there is no better way to find stuff.
